subject: p12530259
History: Patient with history of lung cancer, left lobectomy, one month of cough, hypoxic exercise change in left lung effusion or pneumonia.
Findings: The patient had left lower lobe lobectomy in. Expected stable surgical changes are seen in the left lung with volume loss and mild pleural thickening. There is no pneumothorax. The right lung is unremarkable. Mediastinal and cardiac contours are not enlarged.
Impression: The exam is stable since with expected changes after left lower lobe lobectomy.
